message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.DS 

This paper is primarily focused on improving the generalization of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) through a novel training method called SmoothOut. As such, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), which is concerned with the development of algorithms and models that can learn from data. Additionally, the paper also discusses the use of noise injection and its impact on the sharpness of minima, which suggests a connection to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The experiments conducted in the paper involve image classification tasks, which aligns with the scope of cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper also discusses the efficiency of the proposed method, which could be relevant to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
